column5: Description
Support for the VIEW mode does not need to be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
Support for the HELP mode must be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
A custom portlet mode may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
A custom portlet mode with portalManaged=true may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
The PortletRequest.isPortletModeAllowed method must return FALSE for a custom portlet mode with portalManaged=true that is not supported by the portlet container
A custom portlet mode can have a localized decoration name in the resource bundle with the name of javax.portlet.app.custom-portlet-mode.<name>.decoration-name
A custom portlet mode declared in the @PortletApplication annotation could be overridden by deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The portlet container merges the portlet modes declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
Support for the NORMAL window state does not need to be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
Support for the MINIMIZED window state does not need to be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
Support for the MAXIMIZED window state does not need to be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
The PortletRequest.isWindowStateAllowed method must return FALSE for a custom window state that is not supported by the portlet container.
A custom window state declared in the @PortletApplication annotation could be overridden by deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The portlet container merges the window states declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
A user attribute may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
A user attribute declared in the @PortletApplication annotation could be overridden by deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The portlet container merges the user attributes declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The resource bundle defined in the @PortletApplication annotation resourceBundle element can be obtained through the PortletConfig object
The resource bundle defined in the @PortletApplication annotation could be overridden by deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The portlet container merges the resource bundles declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
DefaultNamespaceURI may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation.
DefaultNamespaceURI defined in the @PortletApplication annotation could be overridden by deployment descriptor portlet.xml
An event with Qname may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation using @EventDefinition annotation.
An event with name may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation using @EventDefinition and leaving namespaceURI empty annotation.
An event with cannot be declared two times - once in @PortletApplication then again in deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The portlet container merges the events declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
A public render parameters may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation using @PublicRenderParameterDefinition annotation.
A public render parameters cannot be declared two times - once in @PortletApplication then again in deployment descriptor portlet.xml
A public render parameters declared using @PortletApplication annotation in one portlet and deployment descriptor portlet.xml in another portlet can be shared with each other.
The portlet container merges the public render parameters declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
Portlet container runtime options may be declared in the @PortletApplication annotation using @RuntimeOption annotation.
A portlet container runtime option declared in the @PortletApplication annotation could be overridden by deployment descriptor portlet.xml
The portlet container merges the portlet container runtime options declared in the @PortletApplication annotation and deployment descriptor portlet.xml
